title: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, National Indian Arts and Crafts and B T Filmsound
brief_description: We follow Mary Thomas, a Sioux Interior Salish Indian, as she makes a pair of moccasins, the most common Indian footwear and a part of Indian cultural heritage. Starting from the treating of animal hide, Mary uses traditional methods, right through to the finished product.
